bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 110 (Wednesday, July 15, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. CAROLYN B. MALONEY of New York:H.R. 3078.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 10The Congress shall have Power . . . To make all Laws whichshall be necessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing Powers, and all other Powers vested by theConstitution in the Government of the United States, or inany Department or Officer thereof[Page H5238]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution and Civil Justice.

summary.text:
Commission on Americans Living Abroad Act of 2015

Establishes the Commission on Americans Living Abroad which shall conduct a study of how federal laws and policies affect U.S. citizens living abroad, including civilians and members of the Armed Forces.

Requires the head of any federal agency that is affected by a recommendation in the report required by this Act to submit a response to the President, Congress, and the Commission.

bill.title: Commission on Americans Living Abroad Act of 2015

item.title: Commission on Americans Living Abroad Act of 2015
To establish a commission to study how Federal laws and policies affect United States citizens living in foreign countries.
Commission on Americans Living Abroad Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution and Civil Justice.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
